page.title: 01 BRANSHOLME SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content:
The central shopping zone, still under development after fifteen years, shows the bleak aspect typical of 1960's "big is beautiful" town planning. Only people arriving by car can arrive nearly dry and unruffled in bad weather.The interior of the shopping centre, in complete contrast, reduces the scale, to a cosy, enclosed human scale, especially the covered market at the heart of the complex.
The surrounding monotonously uniform housing, much of it of "unit construction", now is beginning to show signs of individuality, as people replace standardised window frames and doors, but the open spaces remain as spaces rather than playing or meeting areas and the abundant blank walls invite spray-can graffiti.
